author: IGN
description: Check out the release date announcement trailer for Philna Fantasy, a retro ARPG game developed by Sailike Game. Players will find hours of adventure focused on exploration, puzzles, crafting, and fast-paced combat. In Philna Fantasy, combat isn’t just about swinging swords, it’s your personal  playground of combat styles. Philna Fantasy is launching on January 15 for PC (Steam).
title: Philna Fantasy - Official Release Date Announcement Trailer

author: IGN
description:
If you like this video and would like to see more like it, make sure to subscribe to Eurogamer on YouTube. 

Between No Man's Sky, Starfield, and countless others, the space-sim genre has arguably never been in ruder health. But games that focus on space exploration have a fundamental problem: space is boring. 

It's mostly empty, impossibly, unimaginable stretches of nothing, full of empty, rocky planets of no interest to anyone except NASA geologists and associated nerds. One of Starfield's designers, Bruce Nesmith, recently said as much in a rare podcast appearance, admitting that Starfield's biggest problem is that space is inherently boring.

So, how do you fix the space sim genre? How can Starfield 2 be better? Well, hear us out: by looking to games that are adjacent to the genre: space-based action RPGs, like Mass Effect or its Xbox Studios stablemate, The Outer Worlds 2. This is what What Starfield 2 Needs to learn from The Outer Worlds 2.

This video was created by Jim Trinca
title: What Starfield 2 Needs to learn from The Outer Worlds 2

author: IGN
description:
Nearly a year after release, Kingdom Come: Deliverance 2 has grown into an even deeper and more immersive RPG thanks to a steady stream of updates, free content, and story expansions. With the Royal Edition now available, this video breaks down every major addition to Henry’s journey through 15th century Bohemia, from quality-of-life improvements and new gameplay systems to Hardcore Mode, barbershops, horse racing, and three substantial paid DLC expansions.

This overview covers everything added to Kingdom Come: Deliverance 2 since launch, including Patch 1.4 UI and Photo Mode upgrades, combat balance changes, free features like hairstyles and mounted archery, and paid expansions such as Brushes with Death, Legacy of the Forge, and Mysteria Ecclesiae. Whether you’re returning for the Royal Edition or jumping in for the first time, here’s everything new in KCD2 and why now is the perfect time to experience Henry’s full story.

0:00 Intro
0:28 Adaptable UI
1:06 Photo Mode Improvements
1
title: Kingdom Come: Deliverance 2 - Everything Added Since Launch

author: IGN
description:
Watch the latest Total Chaos trailer for the psychological horror game to see what some critics are saying. Total Chaos is available now on Steam, Xbox Series X/S, and PlayStation 5 (PS5).

#IGN #gaming
title: Total Chaos - Official Accolades Trailer

author: IGN
description: Take a look at the announcement trailer for Ruin: Beast City. Eliminate your targets with style, as you uncover a plot of world domination and ancient horrors in this boss fight action game. Hunt down your targets and... off with their heads. Ruin: Beast City is coming PC (Steam) in 2026.
title: Ruin: Beast City - Official Announcement Trailer

author: IGN
description: Get a deep dive into the Infrastructure and passenger transportation features of Transport Fever 3 in this latest video for the transport tycoon simulator game. From advanced traffic tools to deeper urban mechanics, every system works together to create the most responsive and rewarding Transport Fever experience yet in Transport Fever 3.
title: Transport Fever 3 - Official Infrastructure Overview Trailer
